dublin_core.dcvalue: Panel Monitoring Methods and Tools Learn how one organization leveraged these technologies to help monitor workforce attendance and mobility to improve immunization coverage among the most remote populations by deploying an innovative and reliable tracking service using non smart mobile phones and Location Based Services LBS that allows any vaccinator with a regular mobile SIM to be tracked Hear about how Accredited Social Health Activists ASHAs in India are using a mobile based model to enhance supervision of primary care center staff and improve MNCH services Lastly learn from a Dimagi case study about how to Put Old Data to New Ends Measuring Frontline Workers Connectivity While Using Mobile Applications Presented by Dr Shrey Desai Research Coordinator SEWA Rural India
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:11:21Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 gdhf_shrey_desai.ppt: 4349440 bytes, checksum: d02ada5160f767bdf9392164e5b9a7bc (MD5)
A mHealth Intervention “ImTeCHO” to Improve Delivery of Proven Maternal, Newborn and Child Care Interventions
